title: Covid-19: Markaz attendees are hiding, says Maharashtra home ministry
content:
The Maharashtra home ministry said around 50-60 Markaz attendees are trying to hide and their mobile phones are switched off. The police are trying to locate them across the state. Around 50-60 people who had returned to Maharashtra from Nizamuddin Markaz (Delhi) have switched off their phones and are trying to hide. Police are looking for them in various parts of the state,"Maharashtra home ministry said. More than 200 people had gathered at Markaz for an event that took place in the month of March.

source: https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/videos/city/mumbai/covid-19-markaz-attendees-are-hiding-says-maharashtra-home-ministry/videoshow/75040276.cms?utm_source=facebook.com&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=TOI&from=mdr

recommendations.title: Stones pelted on doctors in Indore while tracking a man who came in contact with COVID-19 patient.
recommendations.content:
Indore: Stones were pelted on a team of health officials while they were trying to trace a person who had come into contact with a COVID-19 patient earlier.
The incident occurred in Taat Patti Bakhal area when the team of five was trying to find out the whereabouts of the person.
